待.definition: to wait; to treat; to deal with; to need; going to (do sth); about to; intending to

待價而沽.definition: to sell only for a good price (idiom); to wait for a good offer

待命.definition: to be on call; to be on standby

待字.definition: (literary) (of a young lady) to be awaiting betrothal

待定.definition: to await a decision; to be pending

待崗.definition: to wait for a job assignment; to be laid off; to be out of a job

待復.definition: to be advised; awaiting an answer

待斃.definition: to await death; to be a sitting duck

待會.definition: wait a minute; stop a while

待會兒.definition: in a moment; later; also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]

待業.definition: to wait for employment; to be unemployed

待機.definition: to wait for an opportunity; (electronic devices) standby

待產.definition: (of an expectant mother) to be in labor

待詔.definition: expert in a specialized field such as medicine, divination or chess, available on call to the emperor (in the Tang and Song dynasties)

待辦事項列表.pinyin: dai4 ban4 shi4 xiang4 lie4 biao3
